item.title: 特斯拉 Cybertruck 首席执行官西德汉特-阿瓦斯蒂在八年后离职
item.description: 特斯拉 Cybertruck 项目负责人西德汉特-阿瓦斯蒂（Siddhant Awasthi）在周日晚些时候表示，他将离开这家美国电动汽车制造商，此前他已在该公司工作了八年多。【原文：Tesla's head of the Cybertruck program, Siddhant Awasthi, said late on Sunday that he is leaving the U.S. electric vehicle maker after more than eight years with the company.】

item.title: 德国北方数据公司收到 Rumble 公司的收购提议
item.description: 北方数据公司（Northern Data）周一表示，视频平台 Rumble 已提出收购这家德国人工智能云公司的要约。【原文：Northern Data said on Monday that video platform Rumble has made on offer to acquire the German AI cloud company.】

item.title: 早间竞价 市场为美国政府可能结束关门而欢欣鼓舞
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 中国暂停对与美国有关联的韩国韩华海洋公司实施制裁
item.description: 中国商务部周一表示，中国已暂停对韩国韩华海洋株式会社（Hanwha Ocean Co Ltd）与美国有关联的子公司实施制裁，为期一年。【原文：China has suspended sanctions on U.S.-linked subsidiaries of South Korea's Hanwha Ocean Co Ltd for a year, its commerce ministry said on Monday.】

item.title: 中国政府力推消费贷款，中国互联网企业谨慎重振贷款业务
item.description: 四位业内人士称，中国互联网平台正悄然重振消费贷款，将中国政府推动降低家庭借贷成本作为一个信号，表明监管机构可能会放松对该行业长达数年的打压。【原文：China's internet platforms are quietly reviving consumer lending, taking Beijing's push to make household borrowing cheaper as a signal that regulators may be easing a years-long crackdown on the sector, four industry sources said.】

item.title: 高市的经济顾问称日本央行应避免在 12 月加息
item.description: 被选为政府重要小组成员的经济学家相田拓二告诉《日经新闻》，日本央行应避免在 12 月加息，至少等到明年 1 月，以支持脆弱的经济。【原文：The Bank of Japan should avoid raising interest rates in December and wait at least until January next year to support a fragile economy, Takuji Aida, an economist chosen to join a key government panel, told the Nikkei newspaper.】

item.title: 欧洲企业做好准备应对 2026 年美国关税带来的更大影响
item.description: 欧洲商业协会（BusinessEurope）周一的一项调查显示，欧洲企业认为美国关税和其他贸易紧张局势将在2026年产生远大于2025年的影响。【原文：European business sees a far greater impact in 2026 from U.S. tariffs and other trade tensions than in 2025, when front-loading mitigated the consequences, a survey by BusinessEurope showed on Monday.】

item.title: 中国暂停向挂靠美国的船只收取港口费一年
item.description: 中国交通部周一表示，中国将暂停向与美国有联系的船只征收港口费，为期一年。【原文：China will suspend port fees levied on U.S.-linked vessels for a year, its transport ministry said on Monday.】

item.title: 美国周日航班延误超过 1 万架次，成为停摆最严重的一天
item.description: 周日，航空公司取消了 2,700 多架次美国航班，延误了 10,000 多架次航班，这是自美国政府开始关门以来单日中断航班最多的一天。【原文：Airlines canceled more than 2,700 U.S. flights and delayed more than 10,000 on Sunday, the most disruptions on a single day since the U.S. government shutdown began.】

item.title: 澳大利亚最高央行行长称澳大利亚经济能力依然紧张
item.description: 澳大利亚央行一位高级官员周一表示，澳大利亚的货币政策面临着不同寻常的挑战，因为去年经济开始复苏，但需求仍高于潜在产出，这表明近期放松政策的空间很小。【原文：Australia's monetary policy faces an unusual challenge as the economy began recovering last year with demand still above potential output, a top central bank official said on Monday, suggesting little room for near-term policy easing.】

item.title: 澳大利亚证券交易所（ASX）任命新的合规主管，应对实现扭亏为盈计划的压力
item.description: 澳大利亚证券交易所（ASX）周一表示，该公司已任命露辛达-麦肯（Lucinda McCann）为新任首席合规官，即日起生效。【原文：Australian stock exchange operator ASX Ltd has appointed Lucinda McCann as its new chief compliance officer with immediate effect, the company said on Monday, amid mounting pressure to deliver on its multi-year turnaround plan.】

item.title: 美国政府即将重开，油价因此上涨
item.description: 油价周一上涨，原因是人们乐观地认为，美国政府停摆可能很快结束，从而提升世界头号石油消费国的需求，抵消了对全球供应量上升的担忧。【原文：Oil prices rose on Monday on optimism that the U.S. government shutdown could end soon and lift demand in the world's top oil consumer, offsetting concerns about rising supplies globally.】

item.title: 因对美国政府可能结束停摆持乐观态度，股市上涨
item.description: 周一，全球股市在亚洲受到提振，原因是市场乐观地认为美国政府结束历史性停摆指日可待。【原文：Global shares got a lift in Asia on Monday on optimism that an end to the historic U.S. government shutdown could be in sight, while the dollar was nursing losses from last week.】

item.title: 经济增长忧虑因停摆可能很快结束的希望而减弱，美元持稳
item.description: 美元在周一的亚洲早盘交易中保持坚挺，原因是一连串疲软的经济数据再次引发了对全球经济增长的担忧，尽管有迹象表明美国国会可能正逐步接近于达成一项可以让美国政府重新开张的协议，但这削弱了美元的避险意愿。【原文：The U.S. dollar held firm in early Asian trading on Monday as a string of weak economic data revived global growth worries, though signs that Congress may be edging closer to a deal that could reopen the U.S. government blunted its safety bid.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳新银行因一次性费用和利润率压力导致年度利润下降
item.description: 澳大利亚澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）周一公布的全年现金收益下降了14%，原因是与裁员和监管和解相关的一次性费用大幅增加，同时竞争和利率下调挤压了利润空间。【原文：Australian lender ANZ Group reported a 14% drop in its full-year cash earnings on Monday, hurt by a significant one-time charge related to job cuts and a regulatory settlement, while competition and rate cuts squeezed margins.】

item.title: 白宫经济顾问：如果停摆持续下去，美国第四季度国内生产总值可能出现负增长
item.description: 白宫经济顾问凯文-哈塞特（Kevin Hassett）在周日播出的一次访谈中表示，如果联邦关门持续下去，美国第四季度的经济增长可能会出现负增长。【原文：U.S. economic growth in the fourth quarter could be negative if a federal shutdown drags on, White House economic adviser Kevin Hassett said in an interview that aired on Sunday.】

item.title: 万豪终止与住宿租赁公司 Sonder 的许可协议
item.description: 酒店运营商万豪国际集团周日表示，由于 Sonder 违约，其与住宿租赁公司 Sonder 的许可协议已被终止。【原文：Hotel operator Marriott International on Sunday said its licensing agreement with lodging rentals company Sonder has been terminated due to a default from Sonder.】

item.title: 布里克报道：瑞士商界领袖之行有助于美国贸易关系解冻
item.description: 据《Blick 报》周日报道，在商界领袖访问美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump），促成关系解冻之后，瑞士可能接近于赢得美国对其进口商品征收 39% 关税的喘息机会。【原文：Switzerland could be close to winning a respite from the 39% tariffs imposed by the United States on imports of its goods, newspaper Blick reported on Sunday, after a visit by business leaders to U.S. President Donald Trump helped thaw relations.】

item.title: 中国豁免 Nexperia 民用芯片出口禁令
item.description: 中国商务部周日表示，中国已对民用 Nexperia 芯片的出口管制给予豁免，此举将有助于缓解汽车制造商和汽车供应商的供应短缺问题。【原文：China has granted exemptions to export controls on Nexperia chips for civilian applications, the commerce ministry said on Sunday in a move that will help to relieve supply shortages for carmakers and automotive suppliers.】

item.title: 股市遭遇减速带，但投资者继续看涨
item.description: 股市近期的疲软标志着推动股市创下一系列历史新高的反弹中的一个减速带，但许多投资者认为回调只是一个喘息的机会，而不是更深麻烦的征兆。【原文：The stock market's recent weakness marked a speed bump in a rally that had driven stocks to a series of record highs, but many investors view the pullback as a breather rather than a sign of deeper trouble.】

item.title: 美国航空公司为政府规定的第三天航班削减做准备
item.description: 继上周六空中交通管制人员短缺导致数千航班受阻后，各大航空公司周日又开始了第三天政府规定的航班削减。【原文：Major airlines braced for a third day of government-mandated flight cuts Sunday after rising air traffic control staffing shortages snarled thousands of flights on Saturday.】

item.title: 中国暂停禁止向美国出口镓、锗和锑
item.description: 中国商务部周日表示，中国已暂停批准向美国出口与镓、锗、锑和超硬材料有关的 "军民两用产品"。【原文：China has suspended a ban on approving exports of "dual-use items" related to gallium, germanium, antimony and super-hard materials to the U.S., the commerce ministry said on Sunday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，威士卡和万事达卡即将与商家达成和解，将降低收费标准
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周六援引知情人士的话报道，美国支付公司威士（Visa）和万事达（Mastercard）即将与商家达成一项和解协议，旨在通过降低商店支付的费用，并赋予商家更多拒绝某些信用卡的权力，从而结束长达 20 年的法律纠纷。【原文：U.S. payment firms Visa and Mastercard are nearing a settlement with merchants that aims to end a 20-year-old legal dispute by lowering fees stores pay and giving them more power to reject certain credit cards, the Wall Street Journal reported on Saturday, citing people familiar with matter.】

item.title: 美国联邦航空局在 UPS 飞机坠毁后禁止 MD-11 航班飞行
item.description: 本周早些时候，UPS一架MD-11货运飞机在肯塔基州坠毁，造成至少14人死亡，美国联邦航空管理局周六表示，暂时禁止MD-11飞机飞行，等待检查。【原文：The U.S. Federal Aviation Administration on Saturday said it was prohibiting MD-11 planes from flying for now, pending inspections, after a crash earlier in the week of a UPS MD-11 cargo freighter killed at least 14 people in Kentucky.】

item.title: 意大利银行支持数字欧元，但希望将成本分摊到时间上
item.description: 意大利银行业协会（ABI）的一位高级官员表示，意大利银行支持欧洲中央银行的数字欧元项目，但希望银行为实施该项目所需的投资能在一段时间内错开，因为成本很高。【原文：Italian banks support the European Central Bank's digital euro project but want investments required by them to implement it to be staggered over time because the costs are high, a top official of the Italian Banking Association (ABI) said.】

item.title: 大型零售商承诺感恩节更便宜，但也有变数
item.description: 食品杂货巨头沃尔玛、塔吉特（Target）和阿尔迪（Aldi）大肆宣传他们的感恩节大餐比以往任何时候都更实惠。但是，这些零售商的做法与购物者的做法如出一辙，他们会选择更便宜的自有品牌替代品，或者提供更少的商品。【原文：Grocery giants Walmart, Target and Aldi are trumpeting their Thanksgiving meal deals as more affordable than ever. But those retailers are doing exactly what shoppers are doing, trading down to cheaper private-label alternatives or offering fewer items.】

item.title: 停摆持续第二天，美国遭遇航班削减
item.description: 周六，美国航空公司和旅客艰难地度过了全国航班削减的第二天，因为政府关门预计将在未来几天导致更多航班取消。【原文：U.S. airlines and travelers slogged through a second day of flight cuts across the country on Saturday as the government shutdown was expected to drive more cancellations in the days to come.】

item.title: 联邦停摆威胁这些特朗普选民的生计，但不影响他们的政治忠诚
item.description: 从联邦工资到公共福利，美国政府史上最长的停摆切断了数百万美国人的生命线，其中许多人投票支持唐纳德-特朗普总统。【原文：From federal paychecks to public benefits, the longest U.S. government shutdown in history is cutting lifelines for millions of Americans, many of whom voted for President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 路易斯维尔坠机事件后，UPS停用 MD-11 机队
item.description: UPS 周五表示，它已经停飞了其麦道 MD-11 机队，该机型卷入了周二在肯塔基州路易斯维尔发生的空难，造成至少 13 人死亡。【原文：UPS on Friday said it has grounded its fleet of McDonnell Douglas MD-11s, the type of plane involved in Tuesday's crash in Louisville, Kentucky, which killed at least 13 people.】

item.title: Nvidia 首席执行官黄仁勋认为对 Blackwell 芯片的需求强劲
item.description: Nvidia 首席执行官黄仁勋周六表示，随着该公司对台积电（TSMC）晶圆的需求增加，半导体巨头对其最先进的 Blackwell 芯片的需求 "非常强劲"。【原文：Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on Saturday said the semiconductor giant is experiencing "very strong demand" for its state-of-the-art Blackwell chips, as its appetite for wafers from TSMC grows.】
